remarks:
If a class equals the union of two other classes, then it equals the union of those two classes commuted. ~ equncom was automatically derived from ~ equncomVD using the tools program translate_without_overwriting.cmd and minimizing.  (Contributed by Alan Sare, 18-Feb-2012.) 

---

 If a class equals the union of two other classes, then it equals the union of those two classes commuted.  (Contributed by Alan Sare, 18-Feb-2012.)
statement: equncom $p |- ( A = ( B u. C ) <-> A = ( C u. B ) ) $.
